text: The proverbs of Solomon the son of David, king of Israel;
speaker: Narrator

text:
to know wisdom and instruction;
to perceive the words of understanding;
speaker: Narrator

text:
to receive the instruction of wisdom,
justice, and judgment, and equity;
speaker: Narrator

text:
to give subtilty to the simple,
to the young man knowledge and discretion.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A wise man will hear, and will increase learning;
and a man of understanding shall attain unto wise counsels:
speaker: Narrator

text:
to understand a proverb, and the interpretation;
the words of the wise, and their dark sayings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The fear of the Lord is the beginning of knowledge:
but fools despise wisdom and instruction.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My son, hear the instruction of thy father,
and forsake not the law of thy mother:
speaker: Narrator

text:
for they shall be an ornament of grace unto thy head,
and chains about thy neck.
speaker: Narrator

text: My son, if sinners entice thee, consent thou not.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If they say, Come with us, let us lay wait for blood,
let us lurk privily for the innocent without cause:
speaker: Narrator

text:
let us swallow them up alive as the grave;
and whole, as those that go down into the pit:
speaker: Narrator

text:
we shall find all precious substance,
we shall fill our houses with spoil:
speaker: Narrator

text:
cast in thy lot among us;
let us all have one purse:
speaker: Narrator

text:
my son, walk not thou in the way with them;
refrain thy foot from their path:
speaker: Narrator

text:
for their feet run to evil,
and make haste to shed blood.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely in vain the net is spread in the sight of any bird.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And they lay wait for their own blood;
they lurk privily for their own lives.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So are the ways of every one that is greedy of gain;
which taketh away the life of the owners thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Wisdom crieth without;
she uttereth her voice in the streets:
speaker: Narrator

text:
she crieth in the chief place of concourse,
in the openings of the gates:
in the city she uttereth her words, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text:
How long, ye simple ones, will ye love simplicity?
and the scorners delight in their scorning,
and fools hate knowledge?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Turn you at my reproof:
behold, I will pour out my spirit unto you,
I will make known my words unto you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Because I have called, and ye refused;
I have stretched out my hand, and no man regarded;
speaker: Narrator

text:
but ye have set at nought all my counsel,
and would none of my reproof:
speaker: Narrator

text:
I also will laugh at your calamity;
I will mock when your fear cometh;
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Then shall they call upon me, but I will not answer;
they shall seek me early, but they shall not find me:
speaker: Narrator

text:
for that they hated knowledge,
and did not choose the fear of the Lord:
speaker: Narrator

text:
they would none of my counsel:
they despised all my reproof.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore shall they eat of the fruit of their own way,
and be filled with their own devices.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the turning away of the simple shall slay them,
and the prosperity of fools shall destroy them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But whoso hearkeneth unto me shall dwell safely,
and shall be quiet from fear of evil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My son, if thou wilt receive my words,
and hide my commandments with thee;
speaker: Narrator

text:
so that thou incline thine ear unto wisdom,
and apply thine heart to understanding;
speaker: Narrator

text:
yea, if thou criest after knowledge,
and liftest up thy voice for understanding;
speaker: Narrator

text:
if thou seekest her as silver,
and searchest for her as for hid treasures;
speaker: Narrator

text:
then shalt thou understand the fear of the Lord,
and find the knowledge of God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the Lord giveth wisdom:
out of his mouth cometh knowledge and understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He layeth up sound wisdom for the righteous:
he is a buckler to them that walk uprightly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He keepeth the paths of judgment,
and preserveth the way of his saints.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then shalt thou understand righteousness, and judgment, and equity;
yea, every good path.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When wisdom entereth into thine heart,
and knowledge is pleasant unto thy soul;
speaker: Narrator

text:
discretion shall preserve thee,
understanding shall keep thee:
speaker: Narrator

text:
to deliver thee from the way of the evil man,
from the man that speaketh froward things;
speaker: Narrator

text:
who leave the paths of uprightness,
to walk in the ways of darkness;
speaker: Narrator

text:
who rejoice to do evil,
and delight in the frowardness of the wicked;
speaker: Narrator

text:
whose ways are crooked,
and they froward in their paths:
speaker: Narrator

text:
to deliver thee from the strange woman,
even from the stranger which flattereth with her words;
speaker: Narrator

text:
which forsaketh the guide of her youth,
and forgetteth the covenant of her God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For her house inclineth unto death,
and her paths unto the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text:
None that go unto her return again,
neither take they hold of the paths of life.
speaker: Narrator

text:
That thou mayest walk in the way of good men,
and keep the paths of the righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the upright shall dwell in the land,
and the perfect shall remain in it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But the wicked shall be cut off from the earth,
and the transgressors shall be rooted out of it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My son, forget not my law;
but let thine heart keep my commandments:
speaker: Narrator

text:
for length of days, and long life, and peace,
shall they add to thee.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
so shalt thou find favour and good understanding
in the sight of God and man.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Trust in the Lord with all thine heart;
and lean not unto thine own understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In all thy ways acknowledge him,
and he shall direct thy paths.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Be not wise in thine own eyes:
fear the Lord, and depart from evil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It shall be health to thy navel,
and marrow to thy bones.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Honour the Lord with thy substance,
and with the firstfruits of all thine increase:
speaker: Narrator

text:
so shall thy barns be filled with plenty,
and thy presses shall burst out with new wine.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My son, despise not the chastening of the Lord;
neither be weary of his correction:
speaker: Narrator

text:
for whom the Lord loveth he correcteth;
even as a father the son in whom he delighteth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Happy is the man that findeth wisdom,
and the man that getteth understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the merchandise of it is better than the merchandise of silver,
and the gain thereof than fine gold.
speaker: Narrator

text:
She is more precious than rubies:
and all the things thou canst desire are not to be compared unto her.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Length of days is in her right hand;
and in her left hand riches and honour.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Her ways are ways of pleasantness,
and all her paths are peace.
speaker: Narrator

text:
She is a tree of life to them that lay hold upon her:
and happy is every one that retaineth her.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord by wisdom hath founded the earth;
by understanding hath he established the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text:
By his knowledge the depths are broken up,
and the clouds drop down the dew.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My son, let not them depart from thine eyes:
keep sound wisdom and discretion:
speaker: Narrator

text:
so shall they be life unto thy soul,
and grace to thy neck.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then shalt thou walk in thy way safely,
and thy foot shall not stumble.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When thou liest down, thou shalt not be afraid:
yea, thou shalt lie down, and thy sleep shall be sweet.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Be not afraid of sudden fear,
neither of the desolation of the wicked, when it cometh.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the Lord shall be thy confidence,
and shall keep thy foot from being taken.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Withhold not good from them to whom it is due,
when it is in the power of thine hand to do it.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Devise not evil against thy neighbour,
seeing he dwelleth securely by thee.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Strive not with a man without cause,
if he have done thee no harm.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Envy thou not the oppressor,
and choose none of his ways.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the froward is abomination to the Lord:
but his secret is with the righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The curse of the Lord is in the house of the wicked:
but he blesseth the habitation of the just.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Surely he scorneth the scorners:
but he giveth grace unto the lowly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wise shall inherit glory:
but shame shall be the promotion of fools.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear, ye children, the instruction of a father,
and attend to know understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I give you good doctrine,
forsake ye not my law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I was my father’s son,
tender and only beloved in the sight of my mother.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He taught me also, and said unto me,
Let thine heart retain my words:
keep my commandments, and live.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Get wisdom, get understanding:
forget it not; neither decline from the words of my mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Forsake her not, and she shall preserve thee:
love her, and she shall keep thee.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Wisdom is the principal thing; therefore get wisdom:
and with all thy getting get understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Exalt her, and she shall promote thee:
she shall bring thee to honour, when thou dost embrace her.
speaker: Narrator

text:
She shall give to thine head an ornament of grace:
a crown of glory shall she deliver to thee.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear, O my son, and receive my sayings;
and the years of thy life shall be many.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have taught thee in the way of wisdom;
I have led thee in right paths.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When thou goest, thy steps shall not be straitened;
and when thou runnest, thou shalt not stumble.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Take fast hold of instruction; let her not go:
keep her; for she is thy life.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Enter not into the path of the wicked,
and go not in the way of evil men.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Avoid it, pass not by it,
turn from it, and pass away.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For they sleep not, except they have done mischief;
and their sleep is taken away, unless they cause some to fall.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For they eat the bread of wickedness,
and drink the wine of violence.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But the path of the just is as the shining light,
that shineth more and more unto the perfect day.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The way of the wicked is as darkness:
they know not at what they stumble.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My son, attend to my words;
incline thine ear unto my sayings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them not depart from thine eyes;
keep them in the midst of thine heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For they are life unto those that find them,
and health to all their flesh.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Keep thy heart with all diligence;
for out of it are the issues of life.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Put away from thee a froward mouth,
and perverse lips put far from thee.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let thine eyes look right on,
and let thine eyelids look straight before thee.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Ponder the path of thy feet,
and let all thy ways be established.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Turn not to the right hand nor to the left:
remove thy foot from evil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My son, attend unto my wisdom,
and bow thine ear to my understanding:
speaker: Narrator

text:
that thou mayest regard discretion,
and that thy lips may keep knowledge.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the lips of a strange woman drop as an honeycomb,
and her mouth is smoother than oil:
speaker: Narrator

text:
but her end is bitter as wormwood,
sharp as a twoedged sword.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Her feet go down to death;
her steps take hold on hell.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lest thou shouldest ponder the path of life,
her ways are moveable, that thou canst not know them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear me now therefore, O ye children,
and depart not from the words of my mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Remove thy way far from her,
and come not nigh the door of her house:
speaker: Narrator

text:
lest thou give thine honour unto others,
and thy years unto the cruel:
speaker: Narrator

text:
lest strangers be filled with thy wealth;
and thy labours be in the house of a stranger;
speaker: Narrator

text:
and thou mourn at the last,
when thy flesh and thy body are consumed,
speaker: Narrator

text:
and say, How have I hated instruction,
and my heart despised reproof;
speaker: Narrator

text:
and have not obeyed the voice of my teachers,
nor inclined mine ear to them that instructed me!
speaker: Narrator

text:
I was almost in all evil
in the midst of the congregation and assembly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Drink waters out of thine own cistern,
and running waters out of thine own well.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let thy fountains be dispersed abroad,
and rivers of waters in the streets.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them be only thine own,
and not strangers’ with thee.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let thy fountain be blessed:
and rejoice with the wife of thy youth.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
And why wilt thou, my son, be ravished with a strange woman,
and embrace the bosom of a stranger?
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the ways of man are before the eyes of the Lord,
and he pondereth all his goings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
His own iniquities shall take the wicked himself,
and he shall be holden with the cords of his sins.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He shall die without instruction;
and in the greatness of his folly he shall go astray.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My son, if thou be surety for thy friend,
if thou hast stricken thy hand with a stranger,
speaker: Narrator

text:
thou art snared with the words of thy mouth,
thou art taken with the words of thy mouth.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Give not sleep to thine eyes,
nor slumber to thine eyelids.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Deliver thyself as a roe from the hand of the hunter,
and as a bird from the hand of the fowler.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Go to the ant, thou sluggard;
consider her ways, and be wise:
speaker: Narrator

text: which having no guide, overseer, or ruler,
speaker: Narrator

text:
provideth her meat in the summer,
and gathereth her food in the harvest.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How long wilt thou sleep, O sluggard?
when wilt thou arise out of thy sleep?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yet a little sleep, a little slumber,
a little folding of the hands to sleep:
speaker: Narrator

text:
so shall thy poverty come as one that travelleth,
and thy want as an armed man.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A naughty person, a wicked man,
walketh with a froward mouth.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Therefore shall his calamity come suddenly;
suddenly shall he be broken without remedy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
These six things doth the Lord hate:
yea, seven are an abomination unto him:
speaker: Narrator

text:
a proud look, a lying tongue,
and hands that shed innocent blood,
speaker: Narrator

text:
an heart that deviseth wicked imaginations,
feet that be swift in running to mischief,
speaker: Narrator

text:
a false witness that speaketh lies,
and he that soweth discord among brethren.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My son, keep thy father’s commandment,
and forsake not the law of thy mother:
speaker: Narrator

text:
bind them continually upon thine heart,
and tie them about thy neck.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
For the commandment is a lamp; and the law is light;
and reproofs of instruction are the way of life:
speaker: Narrator

text:
to keep thee from the evil woman,
from the flattery of the tongue of a strange woman.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lust not after her beauty in thine heart;
neither let her take thee with her eyelids.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For by means of a whorish woman a man is brought to a piece of bread:
and the adulteress will hunt for the precious life.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Can a man take fire in his bosom,
and his clothes not be burned?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Can one go upon hot coals,
and his feet not be burned?
speaker: Narrator

text:
So he that goeth in to his neighbour’s wife;
whosoever toucheth her shall not be innocent.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Men do not despise a thief,
if he steal to satisfy his soul when he is hungry;
speaker: Narrator

text:
but if he be found, he shall restore sevenfold;
he shall give all the substance of his house.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But whoso committeth adultery with a woman lacketh understanding:
he that doeth it destroyeth his own soul.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A wound and dishonour shall he get;
and his reproach shall not be wiped away.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For jealousy is the rage of a man:
therefore he will not spare in the day of vengeance.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will not regard any ransom;
neither will he rest content, though thou givest many gifts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My son, keep my words,
and lay up my commandments with thee.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Keep my commandments, and live;
and my law as the apple of thine eye.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Bind them upon thy fingers,
write them upon the table of thine heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Say unto wisdom, Thou art my sister;
and call understanding thy kinswoman:
speaker: Narrator

text:
that they may keep thee from the strange woman,
from the stranger which flattereth with her words.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For at the window of my house
I looked through my casement,
speaker: Narrator

text:
and beheld among the simple ones,
I discerned among the youths, a young man void of understanding,
speaker: Narrator

text:
passing through the street near her corner;
and he went the way to her house,
speaker: Narrator

text:
in the twilight, in the evening,
in the black and dark night:
speaker: Narrator

text:
and, behold, there met him a woman
with the attire of an harlot, and subtil of heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
(She is loud and stubborn;
her feet abide not in her house:
speaker: Narrator

text:
now is she without, now in the streets,
and lieth in wait at every corner.)
speaker: Narrator

text:
So she caught him, and kissed him,
and with an impudent face said unto him,
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have peace offerings with me;
this day have I payed my vows.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore came I forth to meet thee,
diligently to seek thy face, and I have found thee.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have decked my bed with coverings of tapestry,
with carved works, with fine linen of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have perfumed my bed with myrrh,
aloes, and cinnamon.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Come, let us take our fill of love until the morning:
let us solace ourselves with loves.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the goodman is not at home,
he is gone a long journey:
speaker: Narrator

text:
he hath taken a bag of money with him,
and will come home at the day appointed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
With her much fair speech she caused him to yield,
with the flattering of her lips she forced him.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Hearken unto me now therefore, O ye children,
and attend to the words of my mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let not thine heart decline to her ways,
go not astray in her paths.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For she hath cast down many wounded:
yea, many strong men have been slain by her.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Her house is the way to hell,
going down to the chambers of death.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Doth not wisdom cry?
and understanding put forth her voice?
speaker: Narrator

text:
She standeth in the top of high places,
by the way in the places of the paths.
speaker: Narrator

text:
She crieth at the gates, at the entry of the city,
at the coming in at the doors.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Unto you, O men, I call;
and my voice is to the sons of man.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O ye simple, understand wisdom:
and, ye fools, be ye of an understanding heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear; for I will speak of excellent things;
and the opening of my lips shall be right things.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For my mouth shall speak truth;
and wickedness is an abomination to my lips.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All the words of my mouth are in righteousness;
there is nothing froward or perverse in them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They are all plain to him that understandeth,
and right to them that find knowledge.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Receive my instruction, and not silver;
and knowledge rather than choice gold.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For wisdom is better than rubies;
and all the things that may be desired are not to be compared to it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I wisdom dwell with prudence,
and find out knowledge of witty inventions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The fear of the Lord is to hate evil:
pride, and arrogancy, and the evil way, and the froward mouth, do I hate.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Counsel is mine, and sound wisdom:
I am understanding; I have strength.
speaker: Narrator

text:
By me kings reign,
and princes decree justice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
By me princes rule, and nobles,
even all the judges of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I love them that love me;
and those that seek me early shall find me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Riches and honour are with me;
yea, durable riches and righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My fruit is better than gold, yea, than fine gold;
and my revenue than choice silver.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I lead in the way of righteousness,
in the midst of the paths of judgment:
speaker: Narrator

text:
that I may cause those that love me to inherit substance;
and I will fill their treasures.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord possessed me in the beginning of his way,
before his works of old.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I was set up from everlasting,
from the beginning, or ever the earth was.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When there were no depths, I was brought forth;
when there were no fountains abounding with water.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Before the mountains were settled,
before the hills was I brought forth:
speaker: Narrator

text:
while as yet he had not made the earth, nor the fields,
nor the highest part of the dust of the world.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When he prepared the heavens, I was there:
when he set a compass upon the face of the depth:
speaker: Narrator

text:
when he established the clouds above:
when he strengthened the fountains of the deep:
speaker: Narrator

text:
when he gave to the sea his decree,
that the waters should not pass his commandment:
when he appointed the foundations of the earth:
speaker: Narrator

text:
then I was by him, as one brought up with him:
and I was daily his delight, rejoicing always before him;
speaker: Narrator

text:
rejoicing in the habitable part of his earth;
and my delights were with the sons of men.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Now therefore hearken unto me, O ye children:
for blessed are they that keep my ways.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear instruction, and be wise,
and refuse it not.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed is the man that heareth me,
watching daily at my gates,
waiting at the posts of my doors.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For whoso findeth me findeth life,
and shall obtain favour of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But he that sinneth against me wrongeth his own soul:
all they that hate me love death.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Wisdom hath builded her house,
she hath hewn out her seven pillars:
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
She hath sent forth her maidens:
she crieth upon the highest places of the city,

text:

as for him that wanteth understanding, she saith to him,

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:
Forsake the foolish, and live;
and go in the way of understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He that reproveth a scorner getteth to himself shame:
and he that rebuketh a wicked man getteth himself a blot.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Reprove not a scorner, lest he hate thee:

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:
The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom:

speaker: Narrator

text:
For by me thy days shall be multiplied,

speaker: Narrator

text:
If thou be wise, thou shalt be wise for thyself:

speaker: Narrator

text:
A foolish woman is clamorous:
she is simple, and knoweth nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For she sitteth at the door of her house,

speaker: Narrator

text: to call passengers who go right on their ways:
speaker: Narrator

text:
Whoso is simple, let him turn in hither:
and as for him that wanteth understanding, she saith to him,
speaker: Narrator

text:

and bread eaten in secret is pleasant.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But he knoweth not that the dead are there;
and that her guests are in the depths of hell.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The proverbs of Solomon.

speaker: Narrator

text:
Treasures of wickedness profit nothing:

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:
He becometh poor that dealeth with a slack hand:

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessings are upon the head of the just:

speaker: Narrator

text:
The memory of the just is blessed:

speaker: Narrator

text:
The wise in heart will receive commandments:

speaker: Narrator

text:
He that walketh uprightly walketh surely:

speaker: Narrator

text:
He that winketh with the eye causeth sorrow:

speaker: Narrator

text:
The mouth of a righteous man is a well of life:

speaker: Narrator

text:
Hatred stirreth up strifes:

speaker: Narrator

text:
In the lips of him that hath understanding wisdom is found:

speaker: Narrator

text:
Wise men lay up knowledge:

speaker: Narrator

text:
The rich man’s wealth is his strong city:

speaker: Narrator

text:
The labour of the righteous tendeth to life:

speaker: Narrator

text:
He is in the way of life that keepeth instruction:

speaker: Narrator

text:
He that hideth hatred with lying lips,

speaker: Narrator

text:
In the multitude of words there wanteth not sin:

speaker: Narrator

text:
The tongue of the just is as choice silver:

speaker: Narrator

text:
The lips of the righteous feed many:

speaker: Narrator

text:
The blessing of the Lord, it maketh rich,

speaker: Narrator

text:
It is as sport to a fool to do mischief:

speaker: Narrator

text:
The fear of the wicked, it shall come upon him:

speaker: Narrator

text:
As the whirlwind passeth, so is the wicked no more:

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:
The fear of the Lord prolongeth days:

speaker: Narrator

text:
The hope of the righteous shall be gladness:

speaker: Narrator

text:
The way of the Lord is strength to the upright:

speaker: Narrator

text:
The righteous shall never be removed:

speaker: Narrator

text:
The mouth of the just bringeth forth wisdom:

speaker: Narrator

text:
The lips of the righteous know what is acceptable:

speaker: Narrator

text:
A false balance is abomination to the Lord:

speaker: Narrator

text:
When pride cometh, then cometh shame:

speaker: Narrator

text:
The integrity of the upright shall guide them:

speaker: Narrator

text:
Riches profit not in the day of wrath:

speaker: Narrator

text:
The righteousness of the perfect shall direct his way:

speaker: Narrator

text:
The righteousness of the upright shall deliver them:

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:
The righteous is delivered out of trouble,

speaker: Narrator

text:
An hypocrite with his mouth destroyeth his neighbour:

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

text:

text:

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:
In the light of the king’s countenance is life;
    and his favour is as a cloud of the latter rain.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How much better is it to get wisdom than gold!
    and to get understanding rather to be chosen than silver!
speaker: Narrator

text:
The highway of the upright is to depart from evil:
    he that keepeth his way preserveth his soul.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Pride goeth before destruction,
    and an haughty spirit before a fall.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Better it is to be of an humble spirit with the lowly,
    than to divide the spoil with the proud.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He that handleth a matter wisely shall find good:
    and whoso trusteth in the Lord, happy is he.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wise in heart shall be called prudent:
    and the sweetness of the lips increaseth learning.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Understanding is a wellspring of life unto him that hath it:
    but the instruction of fools is folly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The heart of the wise teacheth his mouth,
    and addeth learning to his lips.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Pleasant words are as an honeycomb,
    sweet to the soul, and health to the bones.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There is a way that seemeth right unto a man,
    but the end thereof are the ways of death.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He that laboureth laboureth for himself;
    for his mouth craveth it of him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
An ungodly man diggeth up evil:
    and in his lips there is as a burning fire.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A froward man soweth strife:
    and a whisperer separateth chief friends.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A violent man enticeth his neighbour,
    and leadeth him into the way that is not good.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He shutteth his eyes to devise froward things:
    moving his lips he bringeth evil to pass.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The hoary head is a crown of glory,
    if it be found in the way of righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He that is slow to anger is better than the mighty;
    and he that ruleth his spirit than he that taketh a city.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The lot is cast into the lap;
    but the whole disposing thereof is of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Better is a dry morsel, and quietness therewith,
    than an house full of sacrifices with strife.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A wise servant shall have rule over a son that causeth shame,
    and shall have part of the inheritance among the brethren.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The fining pot is for silver, and the furnace for gold:
    but the Lord trieth the hearts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A wicked doer giveth heed to false lips;
    and a liar giveth ear to a naughty tongue.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Whoso mocketh the poor reproacheth his Maker:
    and he that is glad at calamities shall not be unpunished.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Children’s children are the crown of old men;
    and the glory of children are their fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Excellent speech becometh not a fool:
    much less do lying lips a prince.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A gift is as a precious stone in the eyes of him that hath it:
    whithersoever it turneth, it prospereth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He that covereth a transgression seeketh love;
    but he that repeateth a matter separateth very friends.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A reproof entereth more into a wise man
    than an hundred stripes into a fool.
speaker: Narrator

text:
An evil man seeketh only rebellion:
    therefore a cruel messenger shall be sent against him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let a bear robbed of her whelps meet a man,
    rather than a fool in his folly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Whoso rewardeth evil for good,
    evil shall not depart from his house.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The beginning of strife is as when one letteth out water:
    therefore leave off contention, before it be meddled with.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He that justifieth the wicked, and he that condemneth the just,
    even they both are abomination to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Wherefore is there a price in the hand of a fool to get wisdom,
    seeing he hath no heart to it?
speaker: Narrator

text:
A friend loveth at all times,
    and a brother is born for adversity.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A man void of understanding striketh hands,
    and becometh surety in the presence of his friend.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He loveth transgression that loveth strife:
    and he that exalteth his gate seeketh destruction.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He that hath a froward heart findeth no good:
    and he that hath a perverse tongue falleth into mischief.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He that begetteth a fool doeth it to his sorrow:
    and the father of a fool hath no joy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A merry heart doeth good like a medicine:
    but a broken spirit drieth the bones.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A wicked man taketh a gift out of the bosom
    to pervert the ways of judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Wisdom is before him that hath understanding;
    but the eyes of a fool are in the ends of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A foolish son is a grief to his father,
    and bitterness to her that bare him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Also to punish the just is not good,
    nor to strike princes for equity.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He that hath knowledge spareth his words:
    and a man of understanding is of an excellent spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Even a fool, when he holdeth his peace, is counted wise:
    and he that shutteth his lips is esteemed a man of understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Through desire a man, having separated himself,
    seeketh and intermeddleth with all wisdom.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A fool hath no delight in understanding,
    but that his heart may discover itself.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When the wicked cometh, then cometh also contempt,
    and with ignominy reproach.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The words of a man’s mouth are as deep waters,
    and the wellspring of wisdom as a flowing brook.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is not good to accept the person of the wicked,
    to overthrow the righteous in judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A fool’s lips enter into contention,
    and his mouth calleth for strokes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A fool’s mouth is his destruction,
    and his lips are the snare of his soul.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The words of a talebearer are as wounds,
    and they go down into the innermost parts of the belly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He also that is slothful in his work
    is brother to him that is a great waster.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The name of the Lord is a strong tower:
    the righteous runneth into it, and is safe.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The rich man’s wealth is his strong city,
    and as an high wall in his own conceit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Before destruction the heart of man is haughty,
    and before honour is humility.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He that answereth a matter before he heareth it,
    it is folly and shame unto him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The spirit of a man will sustain his infirmity;
    but a wounded spirit who can bear?
speaker: Narrator

text:
The heart of the prudent getteth knowledge;
    and the ear of the wise seeketh knowledge.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A man’s gift maketh room for him,
    and bringeth him before great men.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He that is first in his own cause seemeth just;
    but his neighbour cometh and searcheth him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The lot causeth contentions to cease,
    and parteth between the mighty.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A brother offended is harder to be won than a strong city:
    and their contentions are like the bars of a castle.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A man’s belly shall be satisfied with the fruit of his mouth;
    and with the increase of his lips shall he be filled.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Death and life are in the power of the tongue:
    and they that love it shall eat the fruit thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Whoso findeth a wife findeth a good thing,
    and obtaineth favour of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The poor useth intreaties;
    but the rich answereth roughly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A man that hath friends must shew himself friendly:
    and there is a friend that sticketh closer than a brother.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Better is the poor that walketh in his integrity,
    than he that is perverse in his lips, and is a fool.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Also, that the soul be without knowledge, it is not good;
    and he that hasteth with his feet sinneth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The foolishness of man perverteth his way:
    and his heart fretteth against the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Wealth maketh many friends;
    but the poor is separated from his neighbour.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A false witness shall not be unpunished,
    and he that speaketh lies shall not escape.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Many will intreat the favour of the prince:
    and every man is a friend to him that giveth gifts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All the brethren of the poor do hate him:
    how much more do his friends go far from him?
he pursueth them with words,
    yet they are wanting to him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He that getteth wisdom loveth his own soul:
    he that keepeth understanding shall find good.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A false witness shall not be unpunished,
    and he that speaketh lies shall perish.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Delight is not seemly for a fool;
    much less for a servant to have rule over princes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The discretion of a man deferreth his anger;
    and it is his glory to pass over a transgression.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The king’s wrath is as the roaring of a lion;
    but his favour is as dew upon the grass.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A foolish son is the calamity of his father:
    and the contentions of a wife are a continual dropping.
speaker: Narrator

text:
House and riches are the inheritance of fathers:
    and a prudent wife is from the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Slothfulness casteth into a deep sleep;
    and an idle soul shall suffer hunger.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He that keepeth the commandment keepeth his own soul;
    but he that despiseth his ways shall die.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He that hath pity upon the poor lendeth unto the Lord;
    and that which he hath given will he pay him again.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Chasten thy son while there is hope,
    and let not thy soul spare for his crying.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A man of great wrath shall suffer punishment:
    for if thou deliver him, yet thou must do it again.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear counsel, and receive instruction,
    that thou mayest be wise in thy latter end.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There are many devices in a man’s heart;
    nevertheless the counsel of the Lord, that shall stand.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The desire of a man is his kindness:
    and a poor man is better than a liar.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The fear of the Lord tendeth to life: and he that hath it shall abide satisfied;
    he shall not be visited with evil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A slothful man hideth his hand in his bosom,
    and will not so much as bring it to his mouth again.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Smite a scorner, and the simple will beware:
    and reprove one that hath understanding, and he will understand knowledge.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He that wasteth his father, and chaseth away his mother,
    is a son that causeth shame, and bringeth reproach.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Cease, my son, to hear the instruction
    that causeth to err from the words of knowledge.
speaker: Narrator

text:
An ungodly witness scorneth judgment:
    and the mouth of the wicked devoureth iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Judgments are prepared for scorners,
    and stripes for the back of fools.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Wine is a mocker, strong drink is raging:
    and whosoever is deceived thereby is not wise.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The fear of a king is as the roaring of a lion:
    whoso provoketh him to anger sinneth against his own soul.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is an honour for a man to cease from strife:
    but every fool will be meddling.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sluggard will not plow by reason of the cold;
    therefore shall he beg in harvest, and have nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Counsel in the heart of man is like deep water;
    but a man of understanding will draw it out.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Most men will proclaim every one his own goodness:
    but a faithful man who can find?
speaker: Narrator

text:
The just man walketh in his integrity:
    his children are blessed after him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A king that sitteth in the throne of judgment
    scattereth away all evil with his eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who can say, I have made my heart clean,
    I am pure from my sin?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Divers weights, and divers measures,
    both of them are alike abomination to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Even a child is known by his doings,
    whether his work be pure, and whether it be right.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The hearing ear, and the seeing eye,
    the Lord hath made even both of them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Love not sleep, lest thou come to poverty;
    open thine eyes, and thou shalt be satisfied with bread.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is naught, it is naught, saith the buyer:
    but when he is gone his way, then he boasteth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There is gold, and a multitude of rubies:
    but the lips of knowledge are a precious jewel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Take his garment that is surety for a stranger:
    and take a pledge of him for a strange woman.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Bread of deceit is sweet to a man;
    but afterwards his mouth shall be filled with gravel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Every purpose is established by counsel:
    and with good advice make war.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He that goeth about as a talebearer revealeth secrets:
    therefore meddle not with him that flattereth with his lips.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Whoso curseth his father or his mother,
    his lamp shall be put out in obscure darkness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
An inheritance may be gotten hastily at the beginning;
    but the end thereof shall not be blessed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Say not thou, I will recompense evil;
    but wait on the Lord, and he shall save thee.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Divers weights are an abomination unto the Lord;
    and a false balance is not good.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Man’s goings are of the Lord;
    how can a man then understand his own way?
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is a snare to the man who devoureth that which is holy,
    and after vows to make enquiry.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A wise king scattereth the wicked,
    and bringeth the wheel over them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The spirit of man is the candle of the Lord,
    searching all the inward parts of the belly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Mercy and truth preserve the king:
    and his throne is upholden by mercy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The glory of young men is their strength:
    and the beauty of old men is the gray head.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The blueness of a wound cleanseth away evil:
    so do stripes the inward parts of the belly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The king’s heart is in the hand of the Lord, as the rivers of water:
    he turneth it whithersoever he will.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Every way of a man is right in his own eyes:
    but the Lord pondereth the hearts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
To do justice and judgment
    is more acceptable to the Lord than sacrifice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
An high look, and a proud heart,
    and the plowing of the wicked, is sin.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The thoughts of the diligent tend only to plenteousness;
    but of every one that is hasty only to want.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The getting of treasures by a lying tongue
    is a vanity tossed to and fro of them that seek death.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The robbery of the wicked shall destroy them;
    because they refuse to do judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The way of man is froward and strange:
    but as for the pure, his work is right.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is better to dwell in a corner of the housetop,
    than with a brawling woman in a wide house.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The soul of the wicked desireth evil:
    his neighbour findeth no favour in his eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When the scorner is punished, the simple is made wise:
    and when the wise is instructed, he receiveth knowledge.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The righteous man wisely considereth the house of the wicked:
    but God overthroweth the wicked for their wickedness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Whoso stoppeth his ears at the cry of the poor,
    he also shall cry himself, but shall not be heard.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A gift in secret pacifieth anger:
    and a reward in the bosom strong wrath.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is joy to the just to do judgment:
    but destruction shall be to the workers of iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The man that wandereth out of the way of understanding
    shall remain in the congregation of the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He that loveth pleasure shall be a poor man:
    he that loveth wine and oil shall not be rich.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wicked shall be a ransom for the righteous,
    and the transgressor for the upright.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is better to dwell in the wilderness,
    than with a contentious and an angry woman.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There is treasure to be desired and oil in the dwelling of the wise;
    but a foolish man spendeth it up.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He that followeth after righteousness and mercy
    findeth life, righteousness, and honour.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A wise man scaleth the city of the mighty,
    and casteth down the strength of the confidence thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Whoso keepeth his mouth and his tongue
    keepeth his soul from troubles.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Proud and haughty scorner is his name,
    who dealeth in proud wrath.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The desire of the slothful killeth him;
    for his hands refuse to labour.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He coveteth greedily all the day long:
    but the righteous giveth and spareth not.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sacrifice of the wicked is abomination:
    how much more, when he bringeth it with a wicked mind?
speaker: Narrator

text:
A false witness shall perish:
    but the man that heareth speaketh constantly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A wicked man hardeneth his face:
    but as for the upright, he directeth his way.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There is no wisdom nor understanding
    nor counsel against the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The horse is prepared against the day of battle:
    but safety is of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A good name is rather to be chosen than great riches,
    and loving favour rather than silver and gold.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The rich and poor meet together:
    the Lord is the maker of them all.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A prudent man foreseeth the evil, and hideth himself:
    but the simple pass on, and are punished.
speaker: Narrator

text:
By humility and the fear of the Lord
    are riches, and honour, and life.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thorns and snares are in the way of the froward:
    he that doth keep his soul shall be far from them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Train up a child in the way he should go:
    and when he is old, he will not depart from it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The rich ruleth over the poor,
    and the borrower is servant to the lender.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He that soweth iniquity shall reap vanity:
    and the rod of his anger shall fail.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He that hath a bountiful eye shall be blessed;
    for he giveth of his bread to the poor.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Cast out the scorner, and contention shall go out;
    yea, strife and reproach shall cease.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He that loveth pureness of heart,
    for the grace of his lips the king shall be his friend.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The eyes of the Lord preserve knowledge,
    and he overthroweth the words of the transgressor.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The slothful man saith, There is a lion without,
    I shall be slain in the streets.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The mouth of strange women is a deep pit:
    he that is abhorred of the Lord shall fall therein.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Foolishness is bound in the heart of a child;
    but the rod of correction shall drive it far from him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He that oppresseth the poor to increase his riches,
    and he that giveth to the rich, shall surely come to want.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Bow down thine ear, and hear the words of the wise,
and apply thine heart unto my knowledge.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For it is a pleasant thing if thou keep them within thee;
they shall withal be fitted in thy lips.
speaker: Narrator

text:
That thy trust may be in the Lord,
I have made known to thee this day, even to thee.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Have not I written to thee excellent things
in counsels and knowledge,
speaker: Narrator

text:
that I might make thee know the certainty of the words of truth;
that thou mightest answer the words of truth to them that send unto thee?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Rob not the poor, because he is poor:
neither oppress the afflicted in the gate:
speaker: Narrator

text:
for the Lord will plead their cause,
and spoil the soul of those that spoiled them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Make no friendship with an angry man;
and with a furious man thou shalt not go:
speaker: Narrator

text:
lest thou learn his ways,
and get a snare to thy soul.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Be not thou one of them that strike hands,
or of them that are sureties for debts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If thou hast nothing to pay,
why should he take away thy bed from under thee?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Remove not the ancient landmark,
which thy fathers have set.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
When thou sittest to eat with a ruler,
consider diligently what is before thee:
speaker: Narrator

text:
and put a knife to thy throat,
if thou be a man given to appetite.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Be not desirous of his dainties:
for they are deceitful meat.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Labour not to be rich:
cease from thine own wisdom.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Eat thou not the bread of him that hath an evil eye,
neither desire thou his dainty meats:
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
The morsel which thou hast eaten shalt thou vomit up,
and lose thy sweet words.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Speak not in the ears of a fool:
for he will despise the wisdom of thy words.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Remove not the old landmark;
and enter not into the fields of the fatherless:
speaker: Narrator

text:
for their redeemer is mighty;
he shall plead their cause with thee.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Apply thine heart unto instruction,
and thine ears to the words of knowledge.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Withhold not correction from the child:
for if thou beatest him with the rod, he shall not die.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thou shalt beat him with the rod,
and shalt deliver his soul from hell.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My son, if thine heart be wise,
my heart shall rejoice, even mine.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yea, my reins shall rejoice,
when thy lips speak right things.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let not thine heart envy sinners:
but be thou in the fear of the Lord all the day long.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For surely there is an end;
and thine expectation shall not be cut off.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear thou, my son, and be wise,
and guide thine heart in the way.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Be not among winebibbers;
among riotous eaters of flesh:
speaker: Narrator

text:
for the drunkard and the glutton shall come to poverty:
and drowsiness shall clothe a man with rags.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hearken unto thy father that begat thee,
and despise not thy mother when she is old.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Buy the truth, and sell it not;
also wisdom, and instruction, and understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The father of the righteous shall greatly rejoice:
and he that begetteth a wise child shall have joy of him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thy father and thy mother shall be glad,
and she that bare thee shall rejoice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My son, give me thine heart,
and let thine eyes observe my ways.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For a whore is a deep ditch;
and a strange woman is a narrow pit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
She also lieth in wait as for a prey,
and increaseth the transgressors among men.

and remember his misery no more.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Open thy mouth for the dumb
in the cause of all such as are appointed to destruction.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Open thy mouth, judge righteously,
and plead the cause of the poor and needy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who can find a virtuous woman?
for her price is far above rubies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The heart of her husband doth safely trust in her,
so that he shall have no need of spoil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
She will do him good and not evil
all the days of her life.
speaker: Narrator

text:
She seeketh wool, and flax,
and worketh willingly with her hands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
She is like the merchants’ ships;
she bringeth her food from afar.
speaker: Narrator

text:
She riseth also while it is yet night,
and giveth meat to her household,
and a portion to her maidens.
speaker: Narrator

text:
She considereth a field, and buyeth it:
with the fruit of her hands she planteth a vineyard.
speaker: Narrator

text:
She girdeth her loins with strength,
and strengtheneth her arms.
speaker: Narrator

text:
She perceiveth that her merchandise is good:
her candle goeth not out by night.
speaker: Narrator

text:
She layeth her hands to the spindle,
and her hands hold the distaff.
speaker: Narrator

text:
She stretcheth out her hand to the poor;
yea, she reacheth forth her hands to the needy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
She is not afraid of the snow for her household:
for all her household are clothed with scarlet.
speaker: Narrator

text:
She maketh herself coverings of tapestry;
her clothing is silk and purple.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Her husband is known in the gates,
when he sitteth among the elders of the land.
speaker: Narrator

text:
She maketh fine linen, and selleth it;
and delivereth girdles unto the merchant.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Strength and honour are her clothing;
and she shall rejoice in time to come.
speaker: Narrator

text:
She openeth her mouth with wisdom;
and in her tongue is the law of kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
She looketh well to the ways of her household,
and eateth not the bread of idleness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Her children arise up, and call her blessed;
her husband also, and he praiseth her.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Many daughters have done virtuously,
but thou excellest them all.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Favour is deceitful, and beauty is vain:
but a woman that feareth the Lord, she shall be praised.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give her of the fruit of her hands;
and let her own works praise her in the gates.
speaker: Narrator
